reviews.title: Noisy Aussie began pub across road..but..
reviews.text: If you can live with that racket most nights the hotel is nice and central, pretty tired at end of day so didn't really hear it once head hit pillow. Double glaze the windows and problem would reduce, doors at end of corridors would also keep some noise out, although cost probably prohibits that. Room condition was average, but we had a superior suite and size was ok for 10 day stay. As with most things in Bali anything over 5years old is likely to look a little tired. Our hot water was hit and miss, the towels grey but clean. Bed was ok but pillows need replacing. The staff lovely and friendly. The pool needs heating as was very cold as shaded most of the day but if you need a refresh wake up then it's the pool for you. Totally recommend the banana pancakes or nasi goreng for breakfast, last visit to Bali we visited drops on 3 occasions but didn't get a chance this time. Wayan and friends across road very very good food which I would totally recommend as alternative if the menu at drops doesnt entice. Quite a resonable place to stay, but, that pub across the road really is loud and for 4 days straight frequented by 3 loudmouth drunk Aussies, one a female who you would swear was a stripper.. I was totally embarrassed to be Aussie those days.
Wouldn't stay again unfortunately and that's only because of the pub.
reviews.title: In one word; Perfect

reviews.text: We stayed at Casa Padma Suites in February last year.
reviews.title: wouldnt come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outlay is awesome! the pools are clean and have swim-up bars. We had a junior suite about 2 meters from the pool.
reviews.title: Minimal Positives - Max Negatives's

reviews.text: The room was exquisite! faultless. the breakfast is strange, but so delicious!
reviews.title: Low-cost luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week to start and thought it was great. Most of what the other reviews say is true, but no place is perfect. The pub across the road is loud but the music only goes until about 10.30pm. There are good options for breakfast and the food is nice. The pool tiles are an odd green color but the pool is very clean and big, there are not a lot of lounges around the pool but there never seemed to be many people on them anyway. The bathrooms are nice and there isnt much pressure to the shower but i have found that alot in hotels in Bali. We had booked a superior suite which had all the amenities it states on the Internet but it did not look like the pictures. I think there are 2 suites on the corner that are a little different, room #106 & #107, and we just happened to stay in both of them. We left Kuta for a few days and then came back to the Casa. We would highly recommend this hotel, we will definitely be staying here again.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part was the staff! They are so friendly and wanting to help with everything!
reviews.title: Couldn't wait to leave!!!

reviews.text: I'll start with the good things about this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay central to everything in legian area

reviews.text: Good location and good price. Big room. (Premier) Nice breakfast with set menu but lots of choice. Friendly staff. That's it!!!
reviews.title: Simple and clean

reviews.text: Bad things about this hotel were it is right across from the Legian pub. VERY noisy. Could hear it even with earplugs in! Pool is a very un inviting green colour. Came home from tea one night and thought we would sit by the pool for a while. There were bottles and cans everywhere. Cigarette butts all over the lounges. Chip packets and rubbish blowing around. We couldn't find a spot to sit down. We didn't see any staff cleaning up so I assume they don't have any at night. We didn't see any.
reviews.title: overpriced...

reviews.text: Hotel pictures where a bit deceiving overall Hotel is ok for a few nights whilst checking out Kuta area, my friends where upgraded to superior suites which is a better option my room was a deluxe ? room size generous, on my second night i pulled back the bed cover to find rather obvious stains on the bed smack in the middle which shocked me as to why the staff member would even bother continuing to make the bed as they where only good for the trash bin, so called and no answer so went down stairs to front desk and told the reception guy that the bed was badly soiled and there was no way i was going to sleep on it he called and also no answer we both knew that the staff would have left by now so I had to say just bring me up some clean sheets and I will change it my self.
reviews.title: Good central location

reviews.text: He apologized and blamed the laundry people but staff member should have just tossed them out as no more cleaning was going to move those stains.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast service was great shuttle service to airport free if you stay 3 nights or more wi-fi in the restaurant ok but should be in rooms without charge.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it for the price.

reviews.text: I thought the rate was a bit high for January loud music across the street but thats what you expect when a lot of loud drinking tourists are around not much the hotel can do.
reviews.title: Can do better, but overall good hotel

reviews.text: We just spent 16 days there could not fault this hotel, we were in the deluxe room, very spacious, staff could not help enough,if I go back will stay there again,water pressure was great and water hot,the breakfast was also great......
reviews.title: Value for $$$$
Excellent Location, Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nights in a Superior Suite. At first we were put into one of the ground floor rooms which absolutely reeked (Room 107) of cigarette smoke and was in need of a good coat of paint.

Straight away spoke to staff who immediately relocated us to the first floor (Room 204) which was great. They did not seem surprised we asked to move so make sure you ask if you are put into a room which is smoky. If I sat next to the window with it open could pick up the free wifi from the restaurant which was a bonus. Room was very spacious and well worth the A$85.00 a night we paid. Breakfast at Drops Restaurant was also very nice, this is one of our favourite restaurants in Legian. It is so close to everything, including short walk to the beach, will definitely return next year, and will request room 204 and one of the ones next to it. Staff were also very, very nice and helpful. Airport transfers are included which also saves you some money.
reviews.title: Not as nice as last year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a convenient location with a short walk to the beach, coffee shops, pubs etc. I stayed here last year and thought it was a good deal. This year I stayed in a mini suite. The room was bare except for the bed, desk and tv with a lot of open space - great if you have kids to allow them to play but otherwise wasted space. The bathroom was large but smelled like a sewer and there was no hot water - regardless how I turned the faucet, it was always the same temperature. The AC worked fairly well but it was set to 16C when I arrived but the room never got cooler than about 20C (which is perfectly comfortable).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel.

reviews.text: The staff out front were nice but never really made any effort to help out except for 1 woman working there who remembered my room #, always said hello / have a nice day, etc. Breakfast was decent. You have a choice of several sets so it should fit about anyone's taste. Internet in the lobby was essentially non-existent but you can use the restaurant wifi. Having internet in the rooms would be a huge plus.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pub across the street is loud but usually quiets down before midnight.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
